page.title: 16URSWICK PUPIL 75 YEARS ON.
page.content: The most popular name for Little Urswick was "L'ile Ossick" The most common deseases were "measles scarlet feaver, and diptheria." When Christmas came most of the boys would recieve wooden toys that came from Germany, on some of the toys it said "D.R.G.M." which they thought stood for "Dam Rotten German Make." Many boys went fishing in the tarn for recreation. At school the boys and girls played many games such as "guinie pig,tin can norkie, whip and top and shuttle cock, sticking pen, hares and hounds, ping and walk" and other activities. On wet days they would clean their desks and played indoor games. Two boys who were brothers always used to win the "cleanest shoes" compet- ition if they won they were given gin- gerbread as a reward.
